title: How to Make a Cat Ear Phone Holder
category_hierarchy: Digital Technology Art and Craft Projects

steps.headline: Select fabric (very hard!)
steps.description: and make a template for the cat body.

steps.headline: Cut out the template on some interface.
steps.description: Usually one uses it for bags, to give it more body. Some cardboard would also do.

steps.headline: Cut out the fabric.
steps.description: Careful! Switch sides for the second cut out! Cut the fabric slightly larger than what you have marked. It will be corrected soon, but don't cut it too small.

steps.headline: Glue the fabric to the interface.
steps.description: Take some glue that is not too strong so that you can move the fabric after you have stuck it on. The glue is just to hold it in place when you sew it.

steps.headline: Cut off the excess fabric.
steps.description: It's easier to sew (you won't accidentally sew in “thin air”)

steps.headline: Do for the tail like you did for the body: cut out interface, glue on the fabric, sew, fray check.
steps.description: Take in account that the tail has to be larger  than you think, it has to accommodate the cable and everything. Try it out before you sew it. Then put a button.

steps.headline: Attach the tail on the opposite side of the button, by sewing it on.

text: Select fabric (very hard!) and make a template for the cat body. Cut out the template on some interface. Usually one uses it for bags, to give it more body. Some cardboard would also do. Cut out the fabric. Careful! Switch sides for the second cut out! Cut the fabric slightly larger than what you have marked. It will be corrected soon, but don't cut it too small. Glue the fabric to the interface. Take some glue that is not too strong so that you can move the fabric after you have stuck it on. The glue is just to hold it in place when you sew it. Cut off the excess fabric. It's easier to sew (you won't accidentally sew in “thin air”) Sew around the outline  Do for the tail like you did for the body: cut out interface, glue on the fabric, sew, fray check. Take in account that the tail has to be larger  than you think, it has to accommodate the cable and everything. Try it out before you sew it. Then put a button. Attach the tail on the opposite side of the button, by sewing it on.  Finished.
